thread.title: Lois Lerner off the hook, GOP outraged
thread.title_full: Lois Lerner off the hook, GOP outraged | Washington Examiner

author: Curt Mills
title: Lois Lerner off the hook, GOP outraged
text:
Republicans on Friday were outraged by a new announcement that former IRS official Lois Lerner will not face any charges for her role in the scandal involving her agency's decision to slow-walk decisions about the tax-exempt status of conservative groups.
The Justice Department announced its decision in a letter to Congress it sent out on Friday.
"We found no evidence that any IRS official acted based on political, discriminatory, corrupt, or other inappropriate motives that would support a criminal prosecution," Assistant Attorney General Peter Kadzik said in the letter.
  Press yawns, declares Hillary Clinton 'won' the Benghazi hearing Both left and right-leaning media appear to share the sentiment that Clinton "won" the Benghazi hearing.
By Becket Adams • 10/23/15 5:31 PM The federal   matter without charging anyone. The investigation found "substantial evidence of mismanagement, poor judgment and institutional inertia leading to the belief by many tax-exempt applicants that the IRS targeted them based on their political viewpoints," the letter said.
"But poor management is not a crime."
House Judiciary Committee Chairman Bob Goodlatte, R-Va., said the announcement is just the latest stonewall Congress has faced with the administration when it comes to dealing with the scandal.
"The Department of Justice investigation did conclude that the actions of IRS personnel involved in the scandal was 'disquieting' and in that we all agree," he said. "However, the American people should be concerned that this kind of politicization continues to go unchecked by this administration and a Justice Department charged with pursuing wrongdoing."
"You can be sure this will be a major issue during the Committee's DOJ oversight hearing with Attorney General Lynch next week," he added.
Also from the Washington Examiner Fiorina is confident Clinton would 'trounce' Trump Fiorina said while she doesn't know if Trump could beat Clinton in a debate, she knows she could.
By Gabby Morrongiello • 10/23/15 5:22 PM Lerner outraged conservatives around the country and in Congress when the scandal broke. She headed the IRS office on tax exempt groups, and admitted that they applied extra scrutinty to conservative groups seeking tax exempt status in the runup to the 2012 election. Many Republicans say her actions may have tipped the balance in favor of Obama that year.
Lerner was famously called up to Congress to testify on her role in the scandal, and pleaded the Fifth Amendment rather than answer questions.

By Ariel Cohen • 10/23/15 4:07 PM
